id.description: Each service must have a unique identifier.
Each organization must have a unique identifier.

name.description: The official or public name of the organization.

description.description: A brief summary about the organization. It can contain markup such as HTML or Markdown.

email.description: The contact e-mail address for the organization.

url.description: The URL (website address) of the organization.

logo.description: A URL to an image associated with the organization which can be presented alongside its name.

uri.description: A persistent identifier to uniquely identify the organization.

name.description: The official or public name of the service.

status.description: The current status of the service.

fees.description:
Details of any charges for service users to access this service.

Application Profile Notes: Use structured information where available in preference to this text field.

accreditations.description:
Details of any accreditations. Accreditation is the formal evaluation of an organization or program against best practice standards set by an accrediting organization.

Application Profile Notes: Use structured information where available in preference to this text field.

deliverable_type.description: A categorisation of the nature of the output of the Service.

assured_date.description: The date that the information about the service was last checked

id.description: Each service must have a unique identifier.
Each taxonomy entry must have a unique identifier. If combining multiple taxonomies with overlapping identifiers, use a prefix to distinguish them.

name.description: The name of this taxonomy term or category.

parent_id.description: If this is a child category in a hierarchical taxonomy, give the identifier of the parent category. For top-level categories, this should be left blank.

vocabulary.description: If this is an established taxonomy, detail which taxonomy is in use. For example, AIRS or Open Eligibility.

id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier.
Each location must have a unique identifier

latitude.description: Y coordinate of location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

longitude.description: X coordinate of location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

id.description: Each contact must have a unique identifier

title.description: The job title of the person

id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier
Each entry must have a unique identifier.
Each location must have a unique identifier

latitude.description: Y coordinate of location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

longitude.description: X coordinate of location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

opens_at.description: The time when a service or location opens. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix 'Z' when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am East Coast Time.

closes_at.description: The time when a service or location opens. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix 'Z' when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am East Coast Time.

valid_from.description: The date from which the schedule information is valid.

valid_to.description: The last date on which the schedule information is valid.

dtstart.description: iCal - The date of the first event is the schedule. Necessary when using the 'interval' feature

freq.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats. E.g. Frequency use one of WEEKLY or MONTHLY.

interval.description: iCal - How often the frequency repeats. E.g. Interval 2 for Frequency WEEKLY gives Fortnightly

byday.description: iCal - Comma seperated days of the week. E.g. SU,MO,TU,WE,TH,FR,SA. Where freq is MONTHLY each part can be preceded by a positive or negative integer to represent which occurrence in a month. E.g. 2MO is the second Monday in a month.  -1FR is the last Friday

bymonthday.description: iCal - Day number in a month if frequency is MONTHLY

description.description: Human readable description of the availability of the service.

id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier
Each entry must have a unique identifier.
Each location must have a unique identifier

latitude.description: Y coordinate of location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

longitude.description: X coordinate of location expressed in decimal degrees in WGS84 datum.

closed.description: Indicates if a service or location is closed during a public holiday

opens_at.description: The time when a service or location opens. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix 'Z' when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am East Coast Time.

closes_at.description: The time when a service or location closes. This should use HH:MM format and should include timezone information, either adding the suffix 'Z' when the date is in UTC, or including an offset from UTC (e.g. 09:00-05:00 for 9am East Coast Time.

start_date.description: The first day that a service or location is closed during a public or private holiday

end_date.description: The last day that a service or location is closed during a public or private holiday

id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

source.description: A free text description of the source of funds for this organization or service.

id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

eligibility.description:
The rules or guidelines that determine who can receive the service.

Application Profile Notes: Use structured information where available in preference to this text field.

minimum_age.description: The minimum age required to meet this eligibility requirement.

maximum_age.description: The maximum age required to meet this eligibility requirement.

id.description: Each service area must have a unique identifier

service_area.description: The geographic area where a service is available. This is a free-text description, and so may be precise or indefinite as necessary.

name.description: A name for a geographic area.

type.description: A categorisation of the type of geographic area.

extent.description: A definition of the polygon defining the area, in geojson.

uri.description: A persistent identifier to uniquely identify the organization.

id.description: Each language must have a unique identifier

language.description: Languages, other than English, in which the service is delivered. Languages are listed as ISO639-1 codes.

id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier

valid_from.description: When this price is valid from

valid_to.description: When this price is valid to

option.description: Conditions associated with the cost option.

amount_description.description: Specific details about the actual cost

id.description: Each entry must have a unique identifier
Each organization must have a unique identifier.

name.description: The official or public name of the organization.

description.description: A brief summary about the organization. It can contain markup such as HTML or Markdown.

email.description: The contact e-mail address for the organization.

url.description: The URL (website address) of the organization.

logo.description: A URL to an image associated with the organization which can be presented alongside its name.

uri.description: A persistent identifier to uniquely identify the organization.

description.description: A detailed description of this review

url.description: A URL were the review can be read

widget.description: Code that can be embedded into a web page to give more information about a review.
